intro: Stichorkis truncicola, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, showcasing a robust root system that helps it thrive in various conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive serrated edge, while the flowers are yellow and produce a fluffy seed head. Stichorkis truncicola is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
